item.title: Substack launches a TV app
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The move comes as Substack has been investing more heavily in video and livestreaming, as it looks to compete with platforms like YouTube and Patreon for both creators and viewers.

item.title: Tesla launches robotaxi rides in Austin with no human safety driver
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Tesla is offering passengers robotaxi rides in Austin without a human safety driver in the front seat. Tesla initially started testing robotaxis in Austin last June.

item.title: Meta seeks to limit evidence in child safety case
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Meta is set to go on trial in New Mexico for allegedly failing to protect minors. The company is requesting a broad swath of information not be allowed to be presented in court.

item.title: Google now offers free SAT practice exams, powered by Gemini
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Students can prompt Gemini by typing "I want to take a practice SAT test,” and the AI will provide them with a free practice exam. Gemini then analyzes the results, highlighting strengths and identifying areas that need further review. It also offers detailed explanations for any incorrect answers.

item.title: Former CEO of celeb fav gym Dogpound launches $5M fund to back wellness companies
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Jenny Liu is a solo first-time GP looking to back underrepresented wellness founders.

item.title: Struggling fusion power company General Fusion to go public via $1B reverse merger
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: General Fusion's merger with an acquisition company will net the company over $300 million. Just last year, the company ran into trouble raising money from other investors.

item.title: Waymo continues robotaxi ramp up with Miami service now open to public
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Waymo is opening its driverless robotaxis to the public in Miami, starting with a 60-square-mile service area and plans to reach the airport "soon."

item.title: Ireland proposes new law allowing police to use spyware
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The Irish government announced that it wants to pass a law that would grant police more surveillance powers, such as using spyware to fight serious crime, while aiming to protect the privacy rights of its citizens.

item.title: Google’s AI Mode can now tap into your Gmail and Photos to provide tailored responses
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The company notes that AI Mode doesn’t train directly on your Gmail inbox or Google Photos library. Instead, it trains on specific prompts and the model’s responses.

item.title: Here’s what you should know about the US TikTok deal
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: A number of investors are competing for the opportunity to purchase the app, and if a deal were to go through, the platform's U.S. business could have its valuation soar to upward of $60 billion.

item.title: Under Armour says it’s ‘aware’ of data breach claims after 72M customer records were posted online
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: TechCrunch obtained a sample of the stolen data, which contained names, email addresses, dates of birth, and the user's approximate geographic location. Under Armour confirmed some sensitive information was taken in the breach.

item.title: Google reportedly snags team behind AI voice startup Hume AI
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Google has hired the CEO and top engineer behind voice AI startup Hume AI, signaling that voice is increasingly becoming the preferred interface over screens.

item.title: From invisibility cloaks to AI chips: Neurophos raises $110M to build tiny optical processors for inferencing
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: Neurophos is taking a crack at solving the AI industry's power efficiency problem with an optical chip that uses a composite material to do the math required in AI inferencing tasks.

item.title: Anthropic has to keep revising its technical interview test so you can’t cheat on it with Claude
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: The issue of AI cheating is already wreaking havoc at schools and universities around the world, so it's ironic that AI labs are having to deal with it too. But Anthropic is also uniquely well-equipped to deal with the problem.

item.title: Blue Origin schedules third New Glenn launch for late February, but not to the moon
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin had previously suggested that the third launch of the mega-rocket would take the space company's robotic lunar lander to the moon.

item.title: Spotify brings AI-powered Prompted Playlists to the US and Canada
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Now available in the US and Canada, Spotify's AI-powered Prompted Playlists let users describe what they want to hear using natural language commands.

item.title: Snapchat gives parents new insights into teens’ screen time and friends
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: With these new features, Snap is likely looking to appease regulators and parents over concerns about safety and screen time on its platform.

item.title: Quadric rides the shift from cloud AI to on-device inference — and it’s paying off
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Quadric aims to help companies and governments build programmable on-device AI chips that can run fast-changing models locally.

item.title: Tiger Global and Microsoft to fully exit Walmart-backed PhonePe via its IPO
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Tiger Global and Microsoft are offering up their full stakes in the company, while Walmart is choosing to retain its majority stake and selling up to 45.9 million shares.

item.title: Former Google trio is building an interactive AI-powered learning app for kids
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Sparkli said that education systems often fall behind in teaching modern concepts. The company wants to teach kids about topics like skills design, financial literacy, and entrepreneurship by creating an AI-powered learning "expedition."
